02_imu_temperature_calibration_setup.par.why: The IMU drift is temperature dependent and can cause gyro and/or accel inconsistent errors

02_imu_temperature_calibration_setup.par.blog_text: IMU (Inertial Measurement Unit) temperature calibration setup

LOG_DISARMED.Change Reason: Gather data for the offline IMU temperature calibration while the FC is disarmed

INS_TCAL2_ENABLE.Change Reason: Activates the temperature calibration for IMU 2 at the next start

INS_TCAL3_ENABLE.Change Reason: Activates the temperature calibration for IMU 3 at the next start

BRD_HEAT_TARG.Change Reason: Reasonable for most places on this planet

04_board_orientation.param.why: Correct orientation ensures that the flight controller accurately interprets the vehicle's movements and orientation, which is fundamental for stable flight and navigation.
04_board_orientation.param.why_now: The following steps require that the orientation is correctly set
04_board_orientation.param.blog_text: Define the orientation of the flight controller board relative to the vehicle's body frame

LOG_BITMASK.Change Reason: Log all but fast att, Nav, Mission, OF, camera, fast IMU, raw, IMU, video stabilization. These are not needed now

LOG_DISARMED.Change Reason: Log disarmed was only required for offline IMU temperature calibration

05_remote_controller.param.why: Remote controller is mandatory in the initial configuration and tuning phases. Later might be required for operation and/or safety
05_remote_controller.param.why_now: It is a pre-requirement for configuring some telemetry systems and ESCs
05_remote_controller.param.blog_text: Configure remote controller connection, protocol and settings, including channel mapping and flight modes

06_telemetry.param.why: Telemetry allows the ground control station to monitor the vehicle's status in real-time, providing flight information for safe and efficient operation.
06_telemetry.param.why_now: Sometimes it depends on the remote controller. Configuring telemetry early allows vehicle configuration and sensor calibration in later steps without requiring a USB cable connection to the autopilot
06_telemetry.param.blog_text: Configure telemetry connection, data protocol and settings between the autopilot and the ground control station(s)

07_esc.param.why: Proper ESC configuration is crucial for accurate motor control, affecting vehicle performance and safety. It ensures motors respond correctly to control signals and fail safely in various flight conditions.
07_esc.param.why_now: Pre-requires remote control configuration. Uses GCS telemetry if available. Setting up ESCs early allows for initial motor tests and ensures a stable base for further tuning and flight testing without risking damage to the vehicle.
07_esc.param.blog_text: Configure settings for the Electronic Speed Controllers (ESCs), including PWM range and failsafe behavior

MOT_HOVER_LEARN.Change Reason: So that it can tune the throttle controller on 20_throttle_controller.param file

08_batt1.param.why: Ensures the vehicle operates within safe voltage limits and can trigger appropriate failsafe actions to protect the vehicle and its surroundings. It also helps by scaling the PIDs to provide a constant flight behavior, independent of the battery state-of-charge
08_batt1.param.why_now: The failsafe configuration step requires this. During flight tests PID scaling depends on the battery voltage
08_batt1.param.blog_text: Configure parameters for the first battery, including health monitoring thresholds and failsafe behavior
08_batt1.param.wiki_text: Battery Monitors (aka Power Monitors/Modules) - BATT_* parameters

BATT_FS_LOW_ACT.Change Reason: Return and land at home or rally point

BATT_ARM_VOLT.Change Reason: Do not allow arming below this voltage

BATT_CAPACITY.Change Reason: Total battery capacity specified in the component editor

BATT_I2C_BUS.New Value: 0 if vehicle_components['Battery Monitor']['FC Connection']['Type'] == 'I2C1' else 1 if vehicle_components['Battery Monitor']['FC Connection']['Type'] == 'I2C2' else 2 if vehicle_components['Battery Monitor']['FC Connection']['Type'] == 'I2C3' else 4

09_batt2.param.why: Ensures the vehicle operates within safe voltage limits and can trigger appropriate failsafe actions to protect the vehicle and its surroundings. It also helps by scaling the PIDs to provide a constant flight behavior, independent of the battery state-of-charge
09_batt2.param.why_now: The failsafe configuration step requires this. Controller PID scaling depends on the battery voltage
09_batt2.param.blog_text: Configure parameters for the second battery, including health monitoring thresholds and failsafe behavior
09_batt2.param.wiki_text: Battery Monitors (aka Power Monitors/Modules) - BATT2_* parameters

10_gnss.param.why: GNSS positioning is required to compensate for the IMU drift. This is required by the configuration and tuning steps. After configuration and tuning are complete the GNSS can be replaced by other positioning system
10_gnss.param.why_now: Needs to be done before compass calibration
10_gnss.param.blog_text: Configure the GNSS (Global Navigation Satellite System) connection and settings, including antenna phase center location and constellation selection for optimal update rates

11_initial_atc.param.why: Propeller size has a big influence on the vehicle dynamics, this adapts the attitude controller response to it
11_initial_atc.param.why_now: Done before sensor calibration in Mission Planner to minimize the changes the user has to do in mission planner
11_initial_atc.param.blog_text: Initial attitude controller configuration depends on the vehicle's propeller size defined in the component editor window

15_motor.param.why: The motor thrust linearization is crucial for the throttle controller tuning, and throttle-based notch filter operation
15_motor.param.why_now: The notch filter setup step requires this, and the safety of the vehicle depends on the ESC and motor configuration

16_pid_adjustment.param.why: With very large or very small vehicles the default PID values are not suitable for the first flight

17_remote_id.param.why: Some countries require a remote ID for drones to be flown legally.
17_remote_id.param.why_now: Remote ID requires GNSS and air pressure to be configured before, and it must be set up before the first flight
17_remote_id.param.blog_text: Set the remote ID for the vehicle, to comply with local laws if applicable

18_notch_filter_setup.param.why: When the gyroscope signal is less noisy the PID gains can be higher without causing motor output oscillations
18_notch_filter_setup.param.why_now: Before the first flight so that it can gather data and safeguard the vehicle from some of the noise
18_notch_filter_setup.param.blog_text: Configure the notch filter settings, used to reduce gyroscope signal noise caused by the motors rotation
18_notch_filter_setup.param.wiki_text: Managing Gyro Noise with the Dynamic Harmonic Notch Filters

INS_HNTCH_ENABLE.Change Reason: Use the first notch filter to filter the noise created by the motors/propellers

19_notch_filter_results.param.why: The notch filter(s) configuration depends on real-flight data.

19_notch_filter_results.param.wiki_text: Managing Gyro Noise with the Dynamic Harmonic Notch Filters

20_throttle_controller.param.why: The throttle controller is crucial for maintaining altitude and controlling the vehicle's vertical movement.

20_throttle_controller.param.blog_text: Use MOT_THST_HOVER value calculated during the first flight to set throttle controller PIDs
